repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
`scripts/check_urls.vim` manually matches urls in the help pages and then synchronously checks them via curl/wget/powershell. This is extremely slow (~5 minutes for Nvims runtime on my machine) and prone to errors in how the urls are matched.

Solution:
Incorporate the check for unreachable URLs in the validator of `src/gen/gen_help_html.lua`. Run it using:

```
NVIM_REQUEST_URLS=1 make lintdoc
```

comment_data.body:
can `vim.net.request` be used or what is missing from it?

oh, i guess it's missing "async" behavior.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,93 @@
+local ts = vim.treesitter
+local async = require('vim._async')
+
+local query = ts.query.parse('vimdoc', '(url) @url')
+
+local function curl(url, cb)
+  local cmd = {
+    'curl',
+    '--silent',

comment_data.body:
`vim.system` is already async so don't need `vim.async` (since it's not merged)

oh, but i see you want to use `async.join()` below.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,93 @@
+local ts = vim.treesitter
+local async = require('vim._async')
+
+local query = ts.query.parse('vimdoc', '(url) @url')
+
+local function curl(url, cb)
+  local cmd = {
+    'curl',
+    '--silent',
+    '-L',
+    '--max-time',
+    '5',
+    '--fail',
+    '--output',
+    '/dev/null',
+    url,
+  }
+  vim.system(cmd, cb)
+end
+local request = async.wrap(2, curl)

comment_data.body: the redirect `-L` flag and that the error code value is a string, but I think that checking `err ~= nil` might be fine too.

comment_data.body: IIUC `async.wrap` "translates" a callback-style async function to a `vim.async`-style function. But my (vim.)async knowledge is very limited.

comment_data.body: @justinmk Preference for the output format? (here filename is the helpfile's name)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,64 @@
+local ts = vim.treesitter
+
+local query = ts.query.parse('vimdoc', '(url) @url')
+
+local function read(path)
+  local fd = assert(vim.uv.fs_open(path, 'r', tonumber('644', 8)))
+  local stat = assert(vim.uv.fs_fstat(fd))
+  local data = assert(vim.uv.fs_read(fd, stat.size, 0))
+  assert(vim.uv.fs_close(fd))
+  return data
+end
+
+local function extract_urls(helpfile)
+  local urls = {}
+  local source = read(helpfile)
+  local tree = ts.get_string_parser(source, 'vimdoc'):parse()[1]:root()
+
+  for id, node in query:iter_captures(tree:root(), source) do
+    if query.captures[id] == 'url' then
+      local url = ts.get_node_text(node, source)
+      if vim.endswith(url, '.') or vim.endswith(url, ',') then
+        url = url:sub(0, #url - 1)
+      end
+      urls[#urls + 1] = url
+    end
+  end
+  return urls
+end
+
+local function find_urls(files)
+  local all_urls = {}
+  for _, file in ipairs(files) do
+    all_urls[file] = extract_urls(file)
+  end
+
+  for filename, file_urls in pairs(all_urls) do
+    for _, url in ipairs(file_urls) do
+      -- if output is not specified, err will always be nil (seems curl-specific)
+      vim.net.request(url, { retry = 1, outpath = '/dev/null' }, function(err, _)
+        if err then
+          vim.print(('Unreachable url in %s: %s'):format(filename, url))

comment_data.body: Okay most importantly it's missing a way to add a timeout, or I'm not seeing it. This could either be fixed by passing `--max-time 3` to curl, or for example the approach proposed by Lewis: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/34140#discussion_r2173754322
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,93 @@

+

+
+local function curl(url, cb)
+  local cmd = {
+    'curl',
+    '--silent',

comment_data.body: Not the final solution, but need to find a way to have this behaviour. Either by allowing curl arguments to `vim.net.request` or some callback-wizardry.

Current behaviour also checks runtime/pack/dist/opt (seems okay) but that also includes netrw (booo). I still think it should be like this: `$VIMRUNTIME/doc` is easy to supply as script argument, 'all doc directories in the rtp' is not.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,92 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env -S nvim -l
+
+-- Finds unreachable URLs in help files.
+--
+-- Usage:
+--    $ ./scripts/check_urls.lua [DIR...]
+--
+-- [DIR...] defaults to all 'doc' directories in the runtimepath.

comment_data.body: If you are up for enhancing `vim.net.request` in a separate PR please feel free!
#36164 Adds a `:cancel()` method, thus this should not be necessary anymore (the caller can handle the timeout). Until that is merged, this PR just prints a warning and doesn't cancel the tasks.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,111 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env -S nvim -l
+
+-- Finds unreachable URLs in help files.
+--
+-- Usage:
+--    $ ./scripts/check_urls.lua [DIR...]
+--
+-- [DIR...] defaults to all 'doc' directories in the runtimepath.
+
+-- these files are not checked for urls
+local ignore = {
+  ['credits.txt'] = true,
+}
+
+local ts = vim.treesitter
+
+local query = ts.query.parse('vimdoc', '(url) @url')
+
+---Read and return full content of given file path.

comment_data.body:
env vars are cringe, can we add a parameter to `M.validate`, and in the worst case, maybe need a new CMake target named `lintdocurls`

having multiple different ways to pass random parameters to a script, is unpleasant for future devs.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -15,6 +15,8 @@
 -- USAGE (VALIDATE):
 --   1. nvim -V1 -es +"lua require('src.gen.gen_help_html').validate('./runtime/doc')" +q
 --      - validate() is 10x faster than gen(), so it is used in CI.
+--      - to check for unreachable URLs, set `NVIM_REQUEST_URLS=1`, e.g.:
+--          NVIM_REQUEST_URLS=1 make lintdoc

@@ -0,0 +1,37 @@
+name: vim-patches
+on:
+  schedule:
+    - cron: '22 22 * * 5'
+  workflow_dispatch:
+
+jobs:
+  check-unreachable-urls:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    permissions:
+      issues: write
+    env:
+      GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v5
+        with:
+          fetch-depth: 0
+
+      - name: Set up git config
+        run: |
+          git config --global user.name 'marvim'
+          git config --global user.email 'marvim@users.noreply.github.com'
+
+      - uses: ./.github/actions/setup
+
+      - name: Check for unreachable URLs
+        id: unreachable-urls
+        run: |
+          OUT_FILE=$(mktemp)
+          2>&1 NVIM_REQUEST_URLS=1 make lintdoc | sed -n '/invalid URLs/,/^}$/p' > $OUT_FILE

comment_data.body: not a blocker, but ideally this should not create a duplicate issue if one is already open. maybe it can just re-open the same issue every time, by searching for the exact title.

```
gh issue reopen 36597

```

I've created #36597 to serve as the issue that is reopened.

comment_regular_data.body:
> This is extremely slow (~5 minutes for Nvims runtime on my machine) and prone to errors in how the urls are matched.

Spawn it in a child job. I don't think vim.async is needed here, this script is not intended for interactive use, it's a build-time step.

> Spawn it in a child job. I don't think vim.async is needed here, this script is not intended for interactive use, it's a build-time step.

I added `vim.async` so a check for one url doesn't have to wait for the others. Is this the wrong use-case of `vim.async` and not supported by `vim.async`/coroutines? If it's not, then it's indeed not necessary.

> I added `vim.async` so a check for one url doesn't have to wait for the others.

that makes sense, just wondering if it matters since this is mostly a CI job and we can always enhance it later. the `vim.async` PR might take a bit longer.

Looks like this isn't actively used anywhere so we can probably merge it. There are a couple housekeeping things remaining:

- remove this https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/d017f3c9a0b745e0c57feb8c92dcc852948f7301/scripts/vim-patch.sh#L330-L332 and add `test_urls.vim` to one of the "Remove ..." steps, probably [this one](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/d017f3c9a0b745e0c57feb8c92dcc852948f7301/scripts/vim-patch.sh#L210-L212).
- change "vim" to "lua" here: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/d017f3c9a0b745e0c57feb8c92dcc852948f7301/src/gen/gen_help_html.lua#L385

Thanks, I've fixed those.

Currently, the scripts is not used anywhere. Should it be called in `scripts/lintdoc.lua`?

> Currently, the scripts is not used anywhere. Should it be called in `scripts/lintdoc.lua`?

Sure, I guess try it out in this PR since it needs conflict resolution anyway :)

I am expecting it to be somewhat flaky since it will be making lots of network requests... need to think about how to deal with that. Hopefully a network failure can be distinguished from a URL failure.

> I am expecting it to be somewhat flaky since it will be making lots of network requests... need to think about how to deal with that. 

Yeah that will probably happen. I'm guessing checking URLs should be more advice to check them than a hard fail.

> Hopefully a network failure can be distinguished from a URL failure.

We would probably need to decide this based on the exit status of curl, formatted in the `vim.net.request` error message.

If we would call this in `scripts/lintdoc.lua`, it might be easier to incorporate the code in [`gen_help_html.validate_link()`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/2767eac320ef3f422236cbc8ce2228b02e11bd31/src/gen/gen_help_html.lua#L374). We could have a flag that validates the link by simple checks (old behaviour) or by making requests.

> it might be easier to incorporate the code in [`gen_help_html.validate_link()`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/2767eac320ef3f422236cbc8ce2228b02e11bd31/src/gen/gen_help_html.lua#L374). We could have a flag that validates the link by simple checks (old behaviour) or by making requests.

sure

I think we should probably do this as a daily job rather than on every PR/commit. Similar to https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/workflows/vim_patches.yml

Updated the PR to
- Incorporate the check for unreachable URLs in the gen_help_html.lua validator
- Have a CI job that runs it every Friday at 22:22

The GH action needs reviews/testing. I'm curently not sure if that will work.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

labels.description: changes that are not features or bugfixes
labels.name: refactor

title: refactor(scripts): check_urls.vim to Lua + Treesitter
